name: Quadrant
description: The year is 1979. A secret, final lunar mission has retrieved hundreds of moon rocks for study at Aether Research Facility. Overtaken by curiosity, researchers delve deeper and deeper into the unknown.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8 64 Bit Processor: 2.2 GHz Dual Core CPU Memory: 2000 MB RAM Graphics: 512 MB NVIDIA GeForce 9800GTX / ATI Radeon HD 3xxx Series DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2000 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible

reviews.review_text: So far I'm really enjoying this horror / sci-fi exploration game. It's pleasantly different from other games I have played. The focus is on building atmosphere and setting, and not constant battles or twitchy gameplay.   + Solid voice acting (characters seemed believable) + Unique gameplay focused on exploration and ambience + Consistent foreboding atmosphere + Non cliche & mysterious story keeps me intrigued  - Animations can be clunky - Textures repeat a little more often than I would like and it's hard to tell some areas apart  I haven't played through the entire campaign yet, and I'll update this review if my opinion changes.
great game  I find that this game is well developed despite having sub par graphics.  I enjoyed the story so far with alien invasions and insights towards 'perfection is the key to existence'.
Great Indie horror game with great dev support. I ran into a glitch and they patched it within the hour. Heavily recommend getting this game.
This game will scare your slippers off. If you like alien isolation,penumbra,condemned,and scp containment breach,then this game is for you!
This game has a tense vibe and interesting locations. Visually, it's easily on par with most Indy games and the sound design is excellent. I'm looking forward to the next chapter!
